DataElementConcept.preferredName: Edmonton Symptom Assessment System-Sarcoma Modified Biggest Problem
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant mesenchymal tumor for which a distinct line of differentiation cannot be determined. This term may be used for small biopsy specimens for which adequate tissue is not present for definitive classification._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character._A self-report assessment tool to screen for the intensity of nine symptoms commonly experienced by cancer patients in palliative care._The largest difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Sarcoma Change Edmonton Symptom Assessment System
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant mesenchymal tumor for which a distinct line of differentiation cannot be determined. This term may be used for small biopsy specimens for which adequate tissue is not present for definitive classification.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:A self-report assessment tool to screen for the intensity of nine symptoms commonly experienced by cancer patients in palliative care.

Concepts.definition: A usually aggressive malignant neoplasm of the soft tissue or bone. It arises from muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, bone, cartilage, and blood vessels. Sarcomas occur in both children and adults. The prognosis depends largely on the degree of differentiation (grade) of the neoplasm. Representative subtypes are liposarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, osteosarcoma, and chondrosarcoma.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
A self-report assessment tool to screen for the intensity of nine symptoms commonly experienced by cancer patients in palliative care.
